11111211.content:
The loudspeaker screeched above your heads, ordering you three to go to the Captain’s Headquarters. Following orders as they should the two guards lead you throughout the ship. While you three walk you look around the ship silently, there are dozens of different rooms with different things going on in them. There was one lab room, you peered through the window quickly to see a skinny male crocodile pour some kind of concoction into different beakers. You later notice a kind of lounge room with arcade games that assumed similar forms and looks as one’s on earth. You then noticed a few medical rooms where you saw an elderly female raven coughing and a muscular looking male fox giving blood. This entire ship looked like some fully sustainably space community. Then you noticed a few rooms with weapons. As you got a few quick glimpses through the windows to the rooms you saw firing ranges where many different anthros of all shapes and sizes were firing an array of artillery from projectile weapons like on earth to laser guns to cannons.

After looking in awe you slammed into something large and metallic, you notice the guards giggling behind you, you had just slammed into the door of the captain’s headquarters. You heard a giggling from behind the door, “Must be the human, come, come in.” The female gecko puts her paw on some kind of holographic scanner opening the door for you, you turn to her, “Thanks.” You smiles at you, “Any time, lover boy.” Your heart sank as you walked into the captain’s headquarters, they knew. The room looked like a large conference room with large holographic screens projecting what is undoubtedly television from their planet. Most of what was being show on the screens was casual news, you were kind of happy seeing so much familiarity across this ship, so many things that humans do that these creatures do to. Maybe being taken from your world wasn’t what you had planned for today, but at least these creatures act fairly human, have similar interests and technologies like humans and… um… mate like humans, there are even other humans on their planet that they have snatched up from earth, living completely peaceful lives amongst these aliens.

The fox lady turned in her large metallic chair to face you all, she had a warm smile on her face, “Ah, Nick, take a seat.” You end up taking a seat at the end up the table, the captain giggles, “Oh you’re a silly human aren’t you. When I said take a seat I meant a little bit closer to me, I’d like to talk to you.” You get up and take a seat right next to her. She smiles warmly at you, “So how have the last few hours been, adjusting well so far.” You rub the back of your head, “As well as one can adjust to being kidnapped by aliens.” Eliana giggles, “So how tight was Mira?” You gulp, “W-what?” The vixen smirked, “Oh don’t play dumb with me Nick, they told me everything. I find it a bit funny, she always pulls this shit with human males, sometimes even females, she just has this sexual thing for humans. Can’t tell you why, she just has a… thing for humans.” You stutter, “So I’m not her first…?” The vixen giggles, “No, she’s been with many others over her time working here. Just don’t let her intimidate you ok.” You nod, Eliana claps her hands, “Good, now onto what I was REALLY meeting you for.”

The vixen pulls out a large folder, seemingly filled with dozens of papers, “I would like you to look through this folder and pick out a family that you would like to adopt you. See, we come to your planet to observe it, when one of our first ships crashed there we found some eerie similarities between human technology and our early tech. Now more than ever we see a parallel line between the technology of our worlds, the only difference is your line is a lot less developed then ours. We crashed in what you humans call the Bermuda Triangle, we had to sink one of the islands in the area we landed in, in hopes that the locals didn’t spread the word to other humans that we existed. Of course back then we didn’t know that humanity didn’t pose much of a threat to us and assumed your kind was just as advanced as ours. We’ve been trying to break the galactic code for a while now, the one that keeps us from being know to your species and forcing us to kidnap anyone who finds out about us, but many other alien kinds still believe that the human race is too underdeveloped and barbaric for such technologies and advancements that we have, at least on a planetary level. We’ve found however that humans in our society get along fairly well with us anthros, even better than they did with their fellow humans. We’re trying to use this as our main case in introducing humanity to the rest of the universe but some of the high councils won’t budge to this reasoning.”

You just blink, having your mind blown once again from this new information given to you, Eliana chuckled, “Sorry about that little tangent, anyways I hope you do know most humans on our planet are married, do have a stable job and are peaceful members of the community with little to no police arrests what so ever. Now, onto the folder, since most new comers to our planet don’t have much of a resume or way of providing for themselves we let newly arriving humans get adopted; so to speak, by a volunteering anthro family. You will stay with that family for a good two to three years until you can get a well paying job and provide for yourself. You can pick from anyone from this folder along with anyone on this ship who knows their family wouldn’t mind an alien in the house. I’d like you to look this over for the next few days and give me a decision no later than by the time we dock, go it?” You nod and smile at her, “Got it.” Eliana dismisses you as you leave her headquarters. You turn to the gecko girl, “So, what am I supposed to do now?” The gecko girl shrugs, “Whatever you want, you don’t really have any place to be, we just need to be with you at all times.”

11132.content:
"If that was a crash, maybe I need to check," you tell yourself. It didn't land close, it's dark, and you've had a few to drink. Nearby is a perfect tree for climbing and if something crashed you SHOULD see an orange glow of fire out in the dark woods.

Holding your cell phone screen as a flash light in your teeth you climb up toward the night sky. The star dome tonight is perfectly clear in the moonless sky and everything is quiet except the crickets. The last dull embers of your campfire are the only other light you see. If that wasn't a crash, what was it?

Sitting in the tree quietly listening for any sounds of any kind of distress call or watching for those emergency flares people sometimes send out, you do feel something like a large owl land in the tree nearby shaking the limbs. It's the biggest "bird" you've ever seen.
11132.title: Climb a tree and make sure what happened

Just because a big owl lands in the tree, no need to panick. Owls don't hunt people. You still can't see anything having to do with a crash in any direction. Maybe a transport dropped a cargo container on purpose? There has to be some explanation for what happened. THEN you realize somone is in the tree with you.

"You scared the crap out of me," You hear a throaty woman's voice say. This startles you hearing somone speak close to you as you thought you were the only one in the tree.

"Oh, uh... Just looking to see if there was a crash... I heard a noise," you reply to your mystery visitor. How long has SHE been in this tree? You've been camping here for hours...

"I'm Dracha, and we're fine," the lady assures you. You're blinking into the darkness wishing the screen on your phone put out more light.

"You're fine? You were in the crash?" You ask. That makes no sense.

"You smoke?" you ask. She seems to know all about cigarettes and explains the difference.

"On my world, oxygen is only 14%, so it's making my hyperventillate... The doc made up some ignitable stick that can burn some of the oxygen before it reaches my lungs," Dracha explains. "So... "On no... Sorry... Sorry..." Dora groans embarrassed. Dracha giggles again and waves her hand held meter toward both of you.

"You're going to ruin my pheremone scanner transducer!" She laughs as the device is currently overloaded.
1113222212121.title: I like to keep an open mind too

11132222121211.content:
You've made Dora so hot and wet that she's creamed her uniform and begun lactating? It's on!

Pawing at her uniform fasteners you figure out the odd alien buckles and soon Dora is nude from cleavage to crotch. Her two big basketball breasts are capped with very light pink drink coaster sized areolas and two thick long nipples that look like thumbs jutting from her proud chest.

Her womanhood continues to drool her wanton wetness and she hurries to undress you with her eager rushing hands. Your shirt is ripped off as if it's made of paper and Dora begins licking your neck with a tongue so huge you wouldn't be able to fit it in your mouth.

"Yes, yes, this is PERFECT for my studies. Interspecies mating at its FINEST!" Dracha is watching and clearly rubbing herself between the legs as she watches like a hawk as your manhood enters Dora.

"Gahhh!" Dora quivers and orgasms again as you hyperstimulate her nether regions. One of her nipples spurts milk onto your face and the other is aimed at the smooth black surface of the ship.
11132222121211.title: Time to cowboy up with Dora

choices: Go outside and take a look
11133.content: You had decided to ignore whatever had made that noise. It was probably just a meteorite anyway. Plus, you were much too tired to do much, regardless. You slipped into your sleeping bag and dozed off to sleep. However, several minutes later, you suddenly, heard footsteps coming from outside your tent. You also saw some strange shadows coming from outside. You decided to,
11133.title: Readers choice

choices: Something crashes in the nearby forest
You notice something in the sky
112.content:
Your name is Ryan Keller, age 27. You had a shaved head, brown eyes, and a well built body. You had a friendly attitude, and was always willing to help others. You lived in Denver, Colorado

Unfortunately, the last few weeks had been very rough for you. You'd recently lost your job at the local body shop. To make things worse, your girlfriend of 3 moths dumped you for someone she met online.

You were walking through the forest nearby your house late one evening. You were hoping for some way to make your life better. You'd been walking for several hours when,
112.title: Ryan

1121.content: You suddenly heard a strange noise coming from above. You looked up to see something streak across the night sky. Then you heard a deafening boom, followed by a slight shaking. "What was that?!" you thought to yourself. You decided to,
1121.title: Something crashes in the nearby forest

11211.content: You decided to go investigate whatever had landed in the forest. You walked toward where the object had landed, finding burning trees and upturned grass. You then reached the landing area and found what had crashed. It was a large metallic object that resembled a wolfs head. It looked like some kind of ship. "What the hell is this thing?" you asked yourself. Suddenly,
11211.title: Go investigate

choices: Seated at a table with the fox on the other end
In a bedroom and the wolfess enters
112111.content:
You approach the object cautiously as you see a door open on the side of the ship, you gasp as you see a humanoid figure step out of it. The figure shambles a bit, it looks shaken up and battered. You then get a little closer and see it step into one of the shattered but still working lights of the ship. It was a tall muscular wolf and considering it looked like it had breasts and long wavy hair you deemed it to be female. You started to mull the idea of this creature over and thought about how eerie it was that this creature looked so human. Almost like a stereotypical female human, minus the fur, pointed ears and muzzle. She also noticed that there were various bruises and cuts on her body. The fur tight grey and black latex suit she wore also had cuts in it.

She looked around, looking a bit scared, “H-hello.” Your eyes widened, she talked and in English too. Then you see another figure step out, it was another muscular creature like her but this one was male and resembled a fox, “Anita, get back inside, there might be hunters around here. We don’t want them mistaking you as some wild animal, now come on.” The wolf looked saddened, “I’m sorry John, I’ve just always wanted to explore earth and meet the humans that inhabit it and…” She was cut off by the fox, “Well I bet their government would like to explore you, namely your insides, now get moving.” The wolfess huff as she goes for the door they both hear something, that something being you snapping a twig by accident. You silently say to yourself, “Fuck.”

The foxes ears stand up, “What was that, could be a human.” The fox takes out some kind of gun and points it ahead of him. You start to sweat as you can see him getting closer and closer to the tree you’re hiding behind. You then heard silence, you heard the foxes voice, “Looks like it was just the wind. Man, of all the places to crash why did we crash in the backwater planet with silly hairless apes on it.” You sigh quietly as you hear his footsteps get more quiet. Then out of no where you feel something metallic smack against your skull and you full down to the ground. It must’ve been one of those aliens but the strike to your skull made your vision blurry. You heard a voice above you, “Looks like a civilian, if he were militarily trained he might’ve heard me.” You heard the wolfs voice, “Oh boy, are we keeping him?” The foxes voice responds, “Looks like it, we can’t have him going back to his government about this.” You heard the wolfess scream, “YAY.” You then pass out, you wake up a few hours later…
112111.title: Something emerges from the ship

1121111.content:
You woke up to find yourself in a small room sitting in a small chair next to a large table. You rubbed the back of your head as you started to feel sore in that area. "I see you've finally awoken." you heard a voice say. You looked up to see the muscular fox from earlier seated at the opposite side of the table. You froze in your chair, feeling extremely nervous. "There's no need for you to be frightened." the fox said as he rose from his chair and approached you "I have no intention of harming you.". You relaxed slightly, but still felt very nervous. "Who are you and why did you bring me here?" you asked, your voice shaking.

The fox smiled slightly. "My name is John." he said "I come from a distant planet called Furtonia. My colleagues and I have brought you on board our ship to take you back to Furtonia with us. You see, our kind have a tradition of coming to Earth every 200 years, and taking a human back to Furtonia to live among us.". You started to relax as you let the information sink in. "I understand you must be confused." John said "But I assure you that everything will work out just fine.". John then lifted you from your seat and led you to the door and into a large corridor. "Who was that that knocked me out?" you asked. "That was Anita." John said, looking slightly embarrassed "You'll have to excuse her for her actions. She's new to these trips and can get a little overexcited.". You smiled and said "It's OK. I'm sure she didn't mean any harm.". John then led you through a series of corridors until he brought you to,
1121111.title: Seated at a table with the fox on the other end

1121112.content:
You opened your eyes to find yourself in a small room. You were laying on a small bed. You sat up as you heard a noise coming from the door next to you. The door opened to reveal the wolfess from earlier. "So you're finally awake." she said smiling. She approached you, causing you to become very nervous. "There's no need for you to be afraid." she said "I assure you I won't hurt you.". The wolfess sat down next to you.

"Can you please explain to me what's going on here?" you asked, your voice shaking uncontrollably. "My name is Anita. I come from a distant planet called Furtonia." she said. "A pleasure to meet you, I suppose." you said "But is there any particular reason why you've brought me here?". Anita chuckled. "My colleagues and I have brought you on board our ship to take you back to Furtonia with us." Anita said. "You see, we have a tradition of coming to Earth every 50 years and bringing a human back to Furtonia to live among us.". You sat down and let the information sink in. "I understand this is a lot to take in, but I assure you everything will work out just fine." Anita said. She then took your hand. "Why don't I show you around the ship?" she asked. You nodded as she led you out of the room. Anita led you though several corridors before she brought you to,
1121112.title: In a bedroom and the wolfess enters

choices: "No, I have a bad feeling about this"
11211121.content:
After a short walk through the ship, you arrived at a new section. You looked up and saw that the big hallway you were walking through had multiple levels, all containing a number of doors. Several spiral staircases could get you upstairs. The architecture reminded you of a prison, but here there weren't no guards or people banging on prison doors. It looked more relaxed and calm, with all the white and gray walls surrounding you.
         "These are the sleeping quarters", Anita continued, as she guided you by the arm. "Do you want to see one from the inside?"
         "I guess that's fine", you answered, not sure if this was a good idea or not, knowing that she'd probably only have access to her own room. She walked to one of the staircases and gestures you to follow her. You did, and as you walked up, the echo of your footsteps filled the air.
         "Why is nobody around here?" you wonder, while the sound bounced back into your ears. "There must be hundreds of people on this ship, guessing by the number of doors".
         "I suppose everyone is working very hard to maintain and control the ship. You need quite a crew to make sure things go not boom in here", she responded with a smile. "But I agree, normally you'd see some other anthro's around."
Once you set foot on the 3rd floor, you saw a female fox walking towards you too. Coincidentally, Anita had to go the opposite way to get to her room, so you two would meet her.
         "See? We're not entirely alone.", Anita said.
         "Hey Anita! I see you're showing the new human around.", spoke the fox, as she became in hearing range. Her body was covered with brown fur, some small white spots breaking the pattern, wearing only jeans and a shirt.
         "Hey Rose, yea I figured he would want to see a sleeping quarter, so I'm bringing him to mine.", answered Anita, by that confirming your thoughts. Rose showed a mischievous look at Anita and shaked hands with you. "Nice to meet you, I'm Rose, good friend of the wolf over there", she said, quickly putting her more serious face on again. "I'm late for a meeting so no time to talk right now, but I'm sure we'll meet again." and walked on.
         "Come", said Anita, "my quarters are right here, do you want to come in?"

The look of Rose and the enthusiasm of Anita bothered you a bit. Was this a good idea? Who knows what she is up to in there. Your thought for a moment before answering:
11211121.title: The sleeping quarters

112111211.content: "Sure." you replied as you followed Anita. She then led you to one of the doors. She placed her paw on some kind of miniature, holographic scanner. The scanner beeped and the door slid aside. You walked into a room that resembled a hotel suite. There was a small couch, a dining area with a table and chairs, a small bathroom with a large tub, and a bedroom with a large bed. You gazed at everything in the room. "I guess you like it, huh?" Anita asked, grinning. You nodded as you stood next to Anita for several seconds. Then Anita led you into,
112111211.title: "Yes, thanks."

11211122.content:
Anita led you to a pair of doors, and opened them. You both walked into a room with a large transparent dome, which gave a spectacular view of space. There were several computer consoles inside the room. Seated at one of the consoles, was a large muscular fox. He turned around in his seat and smiled when he saw you. "I see you've finally awoken." the fox said as he stood up and approached you. "I am John. I'm the captain of this vessel.". He held out his paw and you shook it awkwardly. "A pleasure to meet you, I guess." you said, nervously.

John smiled and looked at Anita. "I see you've made acquaintances with my newest recruit, Anita." he said. You nodded your head. "Don't worry." John replied "She'll guide you though everything you'll need to know.". John then turned to Anita. "Take him on a quick tour of the ship, then show him to his sleeping quarters." he said. "Yes, sir." Anita said as she took your hand and led you out of the room and back into the hallways. Several minutes later, Anita brought you to,
11211122.title: The bridge

choices: The Spaceship Lands in the Center of Town
The Aliens Notice You and Abduct You
Another Spaceship Appears and Attacks the First Spaceship
1122.content:
As you're walking down the street, you hear something, a buzzing noise and then you look up into the air to see a strange light obscured by the clouds. "What the?" you ask. You look closer and see that the clouds are parting for some reason and then you gasp because the buzzing appeared to be coming from strange propellor in the sky. The propellor was attached to a giant blue spaceship with graffiti painted over it in such a matter that would remind you of that movie, Akira. That thing in the sky must've been home to aliens. You step back. Aliens! The aliens were here.

What will their next move be?
1122.title: The Thing in the Sky

choices: You're Called to Meet with the Rest of the Crew
11222.content:
It doesn't look like anyone else noticed the spaceship yet, which baffles you. You'd think that such a brightly colored rocket ship that big would attract a lot more attention. You you up and then the spaceship starts to turn around and face your direction as you gulp and nervously step back. You then let out a sigh. "Geez Ryan," you say to yourself. "What are you worried about? Those aliens obviously haven't..." Before you could finish your sentence, a blue light shines on you.

"Uh-oh," you say. "Looks like I spoke too soon." You begin to run as the spaceship follows after you. Before you can get any farther, it shoots a tractor beam and you yell as you're sucked right inside at a rapid speed. For minutes you see nothing but light and then... you pass out.

When you wake up, you let out a grunt and look down and gasp as you see you have been dressed in a strange Sentai style uniform that was yellow with a symbol on it resembling a giant paw with the rings of saturn over it.

You see you're atop a strange table and get up and spot something that catches your attention immediately. It was a literal frog man, dark green in color with a purple version of the uniform on you. He had to be half your height and was looking at you with a grin. "An alien!" you yell. "Relax kid," says the frog man in a slight Boston accent. "We ain't here to conquer your planet. Heck, what kind of nut would want that train wreck? And congratulations, you've been drafted." You look at your uniform and see a holster with some kind of weapon. "Are you the captain?" you ask the frog.

The frog man just lets out a laugh. "No, just the talent scout and believe me, you won't feel out of place. We've got all kinds of species in this crew. Need all the help we can get." "What for?" you ask. The frog just smirked. "You'll see." He said.

At that moment...
11222.title: The Aliens Notice You and Abduct You

112222.content:
Suddenly there was a crackling noise and you covered your ears. It appeared that there was a sound over the speakers. "Croaker," said a female voice over the speaker. "Bring the new recruit in to meet with the rest of the crew." You gave a look of surprise before turning to the frog man. "New recruit?" you asked. "New recruit?! What is that all about." Croaker, who you assume is the frog man gave a smile. "You'll see, kid. You're aboard the Javelin. See, we've been going around recruiting beings from different planets to combat the Sevarian."" "What's a Sevarian?" you asked Croaker. Croaker let out a ribbit before answering you. "They're the nastiest aliens you'll ever meet. No conscience, no regard for life, no restraint. The universe would be better off if they never existed because all they do is pillage, destroy and conduct cruel experiments, in that order. They're not a kind of anything if you know what you mean."

You were suddenly very afraid as you follow Croaker. "So, Croaker is it, how many people are there in the crew." Croaker lets out a ribbit again. "Including you and me, fifteen. Below General Nala, there are three divisions of this crew. First is the Nerve unit that consists of the crew's best fighters. Then there's the Brain unit, with yours truly. We specially in the jobs requiring intelligence such as finding young talent. Last is the Heart Unit. People in that unit have jobs requiring special powers. There are 5 of us in the Nerve Unit so far, 4 in the Heart Unit and 4 in the Brain Unit. Though I highly doubt you'll be assigned to the brain unit. Right this way kid."

You didn't know what to expect. "Uh Croaker," you said. "Are there any other frogs in the crew." "Nope. I'm the only one. I was put in the Brain Unit because I'm not a battler." You and Croaker walked into the main room to find the conference of the ship and the entire rest of the crew was there. There were fours seats in the main room, three of which were labeled with the images of a heart, a brain and a nerve. In the Nerve seat was a white furred wolf man built like a WWE wrestler with a Hulk Hogan-esque mustache and a red uniform with a grim expression on his face. He was surrounded by an alligator snapping turtle man dressed like a ninja complete with a naginata blade, a brownish skinned hippopotamus woman with white hair in a purple unitard with a red jacket, a teenage shark man resembling a hammerhead sharp with spiked shoes and a baboon man in a karate outfit.

You then turn to the Brain seat as Croaker ran up to his leader. From the looks of it the leader of the Brain division was what appeared to be a bat man in blue Tron-Style cyberpunk armor and goggles. He appeared to be polishing a sniper rifle. Besides Croaker, his team consisted of a crocodile man in steampunk armor that obscured his entire body and a chubby bespectacled pink and purple furred cow woman dressed like a doctor.

The Heart Seat was occupied by a cobra woman who had strange symbols marked on her body and appeared to be wearing sunglasses. She wore a green uniform. Her unit consisted of a rockhopper penguin whose uniform seemed to include a cloak, an eagle man whose uniform resembled an unbuckled straight-jacket and a wild boar woman who appeared to be wearing a Mad Max inspired outfit with spike decorations.

The leader of the crew was a lioness in a golden yellow colored uniform who also appeared to be wearing an eyepatch. As she took a closer look at you the three commanders were forming their own opinions. "Is this a joke?" asked the wolf man before glaring at the bat man. "Vladios, your frog really screwed up this time. I don't even know what the hell kind of creature that is. It doesn't look like it would last five seconds against a Sevarian." "How blind you are Clancifer," said the bat man, Vladios. "After all, it was Croaker who found several of your warriors." The hippo woman and shark boy behind Clancifer smiled at that before Clancifer growled. The cobra woman inched up to you and let out a hiss. "There's an unusual aura emanating from this one. Perhaps we've found the turning point in the war." "You're reading between the lines Braco," said Clancifer. "General Nala, you can't seriously be considering allowing this... whatever it is in the crew. It's from Earth. Everyone knows that planet could self-destruct any day.

Nala, the lioness leader looked down at you and you gave a nervous look, but she nodded her head and let out a growl. "In this universe, anyone who isn't a Sevarian is an ally. As of this moment he's one of us and begins basic training immediately." You had no idea what you were getting into. Which unit were you going to be assigned to?
112222.title: Crew or Zoo?

1122222.content:
You didn't know who you were going to be assigned to. Clancifer the wolf leader of the Nerve Unit already didn't like you, the cobra woman Braco, leader of the Heart Unit gave you the creeps and you didn't know anything about Vladios, the leader of the Brain Unit, other than the fact he was Croaker's boss.

You see General Nala look at Vladios and Clancifer as Clancifer gives a face of concern and Vladios adjusts his googles. "I've made my decision," said Nala. "The Earthling will be assigned to the..."
1122222.title: Brain or Nerve Unit

11222221.content:
".... the Brain Unit." Croaker smiled at that thought. "Welcome to the club, kid." Said the frog man. Vladios, the bat leader of the Brain Unit certainly didn't expect you to be assigned to him. However, the wolf man, Clancifer let out a mocking laugh at Vladios. "Hear that, Vladios? He's your problem." Vladios simply ignored the wolf and gestured for you and Croaker to follow him. You do so and see a glint in Vladios's goggles. You turned to Croaker to ask him more questions. "Exactly what have I gotten myself into? The Brain Unit? How the hell do I qualify. I'm hardly the smartest human on Earth." Croaker let out a ribbit. "This is war, Ryan," he said. "Beggars can't be choosers." "But you choose me!"

Vladios looked back and scanned you with a strange device built into his goggles. It made a strange noise before Vladios checked the readings. "It says here your species is known as a human, homo sapien." Vladios clicked on something on his goggles and it appeared to show him lines of information about the human race. From the look on his face, Vladios didn't like what he saw. "At this rate, the Earth doesn't need the Sevarians to destroy it. Croaker, are you sure we need someone like this in the army?" Croaker gave a smirk. "At least this shows they know how to destroy people, Bossman." Vladios let out a sigh. "Come, we don't have time to argue. Tock, Arizona, come, the human will just have to come along on our mission." The crocodile man and the cow woman nodded their heads and followed Vladios as you and Croaker followed behind.

At one point the cow woman turned her head to look back at you. "I know of a similar species where I come from. We have an animal that looks just like his kind, but smaller. Their flesh is quite delicious." Now that frightened you. "Don't let Arizona scare you," said Croaker. "Her kind are the apex predators on her planet. We recruited her after we learned she wiped out a synthetic virus created by the Sevarians. In this world, flying without a doctor is like running forward into enemy cannon fire."

You take Croaker's word for it before the five of you reach an area of the ship where there appear to be smaller spacecrafts. You followed Vladios into a steampunk style craft similar in appearance to a fish's skull. You look at Tock the crocodile man and assume that he was the one who built this craft given both it and his armor had steampunk undertones.

"What better way to test our new recruit than a trial by fire?" asked Vladios. "We've received a distress call from Mercury. Dress light but not too light. It's the closet planet to the sun." With that Vladios's crew took off with you along for the ride.
11222221.title: Brain Unit

11222222.content:
"The Nerve Unit." You were now suddenly, very afraid. That lioness woman just assigned you to the Nerve Unit run by Clancifer, that angry wolf man. Needless to say, Clancifer wasn't happy about it and protested. "You can't be serious, General! That scrawny... thing, in my unit? He wouldn't last a tenth of a second against a Sevarian!" "Well," said Nala. "Then it is your job to prepare him for work in the field."

The wolf man grumbled to himself as he gestured for you to follow him and his team. Croaker looked somewhat in concern for you as you nervously followed. "Listen here, human," said the wolf-man. "Ryan." You protested. "Whatever," said Clancifer. "Just to let you know, Sevarians are the most murderous species this side of the Milky Way. If they aren't killed on sight, you will be. There's a reason this branch of the army is called the Nerve Unit. There is no room for cowards around here. Are you a coward?! Ryan!?" You step back as one of Clancifer's soldiers, the blackbelt baboon, spoke out. "Leave him alone, Clancifer. Threatening one to be brave does not make him any less fearful." The snapping turtle ninja simply sharpened his sword before the hippo woman walked up to you to get a good look. "I'll agree with you that he's exactly what we expect in a soldier, but Rome wasn't built in a day, Chief," she said. "It wasn't destroyed in a day either."

However, despite his crew's protests, Clancifer still wasn't keen on you being in the Nerve Unit, until he got a sinister smile on his face. "Boys," he said. "And Delilah. I think that if the kid's gonna be in the Nerve Unit, it's up to us to harden him into the crew. After all, the Sevarians won't take any prisoners. Congratulations, Ryan. You're heading for the arena." Croaker overheard this and was now very afraid. "Arena?" you ask. "What arena?" The hammer headed shark boy let out a snicker. "You'll see." You nervously follow the rest of the Nerve crew under the deck before Croaker walks up to you.

"Ryan," the frog man said. "You don't have any idea what you're getting into. Clancifer is going to send all members of the Nerve Unit after you. That wolf is practically the drill sergeant from hell." "Go on," you say nervously. "His training regime is absolutely brutal," said Croaker. "Only the strongest warriors last as members of his crew." First Croaker points to the snapping turtle ninja. "Picasso was actually a mercenary hired to assassinate Clancifer by the one Sevarian that survived a fight with the old wolf. Clancifer caught him in the act and the two were beating on each other for days. They were so evenly matched, Clancifer drafted him." You could se Picasso glare from the reflection in his dagger.

Then Croaker points to the baboon man. "Wukong is a level eighty blackbelt in Cosmic Karate. He was initially hired by the army to train a new generation of martial artists before he got transferred to us." Then Croaker pointed to the hippopotamus woman. "Delilah over there is the queen of the warrior women of planet Hippolyta. And let me tell you, you don't want to pick a fight with the hippo women of Hippolyta." Finally you look at the teenage shark by Clancifer. "What about the shark boy?" you ask. "Sledge?" asked Croaker. "He's been with the Nerve Unit since before he was a year old. "You inducted a baby?!" you yelled in shock. "This is war," said Croaker. "The Sevarians won't spare children. At least we can give them a way to defend themselves."

Soon Clancifer leads you and the rest of the Nerve Unit to an arena and tosses you in the center as you yell. "Welcome to Boot Camp, Earthling," says the wolf man. "You want to stay alive, we'll show you first hand a fraction of what the Sevarians will do to you." Croaker simply moved to the side to watch the fight with a somber look on his face. "I really hope Clancifer knows what he's doing. For your sake."

Who is your first opponent?
11222222.title: Nerve Unit

112222221.content:
You suddenly hear yelling from behind you you and look quickly, only to seen Sledge charging at you. It looks like he was going to throw a punch so you quickly block his punch and spin behind him, elbow striking him on his shoulder. He screamed in pain as you did this and he falls to the ground.

" How the hell did you do that?" He asks, still in major pain.

"I'm an 8th degree black belt in GOJU-RYU Karate, and what I just did is fairly simple." You say with a big smirk on your face. Then suddenly a knife goes flying by your head. You turn around to see Picasso standing their. He looks like he wants to rip your eyes out. Then he jumps out of sight and you are thrown off completely, how could a snapping turtle jump so high and so fast. Then you hear him land behind you, and you take action. You foot sweep him and then strike his chest, which causes him to gasp for air.

"If these guys are your best warriors then there is something wrong." You say mockingly. Then you get hit from behind. Wukong! He is fast just as a Monkey should be you think to yourself. Then he says to you.

"So your an 8th degree black belt too? Very interesting... Maybe we misjudged you." He said.

"Well you know the saying, don't judge a book by its cover." You say like a smart ass.

Then the Monkey man runs at you and starts to throw moves at you that you had never seen before, yet some how your able to defend against all of his attacks.

'Its a good thing I took Karate' you thought to yourself. As you keep fighting you notice that every time Wukong threw a right punch he would throw 3 lefts after. You used this to your advantage. Right after he threw his right punch you came in and hammered his ribs with all you had and it brote him to his knee's.

'Well three down, one to go.' You said to yourself. Then Delilah walks out. She looked very calm. She started to run at you and you had figured out what to do. As she ran at you, you slid under her and jumped on her back and put her in a choke hold. She grabbed your arms and just threw you off of her, she wasn't even trying., at least it seemed that way. You had to come up with something quick. You knew that if you fought her head on you would get creamed. So you used your speed to your advantage. You get behind her again and jump on her back and grab just above her collar bone, and squeeze. Within seconds she passes out on the ground. You stand up and give a light chuckle.

"Wow I didn't think I would be able to finish them all off so quickly." You say to yourself.

Then you heard a loud thump from behind. You look an their stands...
112222221.title: Sledge

choices: Something has crash-landed near your location
A figure emerges from the near-by woods
113.content:
Your name is Andrew Mercer and you live in a small town called Silver Creek out in the middle of nowhere. Silver Creek is named after a creek that has the same name that runs through the town. The town's population is perhaps 3,500. It was once a mining town back in the 1900s but the Great Depression effectively killed it; it's slowly turning into a ghost town now.

You're 24 years old have have short brown hair and average looks. You work at the only grocery store in town.

You just love to stargaze with the telescope you got one Christmas when you were sixteen. You never discovered anything awesome like a new planet or anything...not that you're looking to discover anything..you just like looking up at the night sky. You stargaze on a high hill that overlooks the town and the surrounding area.

One night you're stargazing through your telescope when you spot...
113.title: Stargazer Andrew

1131.content:
You looked up and gasped because there appeared to be a giant flying saucer in the sky. This flying saucer appeared to be completely black in appearance except for the face that it fuchsia tron-lines over it. The wolf shrugged, “I don’t know, they’re resourceful. She then growls at you, “Are you fucking kidding me, ok, if you’re looking for a fight you’ll get one.” She rushes up to you, you try to deliver a punch but she catches it in her paw and squeezes your fist effortlessly, you start to scream as it feels like every bone in your hand is turning to dust, “Ok, ok I give.”

See to make a long story short, humans went extinct on our planet thousands of years ago. They were more technologically advanced then the humans on your planet. They were soon threatened by a powerful alien virus they had never encountered before because they were fairly reserved to themselves and barely ever dealt with off world species, leading to a vulnerability to alien viruses and sicknesses. Humanity was soon brought to it’s knees but they infused human DNA with DNA from animals on their planet and that created our kind. Humans called us Anthros, made sense since we were pretty much the humanized versions of the animals on their planet. Now this is great for us because we may be able to either work alongside with the humans on your planet or reverse what the humans had done to create us and in effect recreate humanity on our planet using you and your genome. To be honest once we found you, you didn’t really have much of a choice we would’ve taken you on board anyways, either with or without force.”

You rub your head, “This is a lot to take in.” The lioness nods, “I understand, it must be quite the shell shock to be talking with a humanoid animal.” You nod and chuckle, “You could say that again.” This makes the lioness chuckle, “My name’s Rein by the way.” She extends a paw to you, “Do humans still shake hands?” You take her paw and shake it, “Yeah we do, and the name’s Andrew.” Rein chuckles and licks your cheek, “Nice to meet you, you hungry at all?” You answer, “Actually yeah I am.” She gets up and gestures for you to follow her, “Come on it’s almost dinner time.” You get up and follow her, “Awesome what are we having?” Rein chuckles, “Oh you’ll see.”

You looked to your right to see a small door slide open, revealing a female cougar standing in the doorway. She had an extremely shapely figure and had pink fur covering her body. "I see that your awake." she said, smiling as she approached you "And it seems your checkup shows that you're in perfect health.". You started shaking slightly, not knowing what was going on. "There's no need for you to feel nervous." the female cougar said, gently caressing your arm "I'm not here to harm you.". You relaxed slightly, knowing you'd be safe. "Who are you and why did you bring me here?" you asked.

The female cougar chuckled and replied "My name is Kellina. I brought you on board my ship after you accidently stumbled upon it after I crashed.". She paused, beginning to blush slightly. "I should apologize for accidently knocking you unconscious. I thought you might attack me.". You blushed and replied "It's OK. But I'd appreciate it if you'd take me back home.". Kellina frowned and said "I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I can't. I couldn't risk you returning and exposing us to your kind.". You looked down, upset that you wouldn't be able to go back home. The female cougar smiled and replied "I assure you that you'll be perfectly fine.". You shrugged and asked "So, where will I be staying?". Kellina smiled and replied "With me.". You looked at her puzzled and Kellina explained further "This entire ship is my home. I spend my time traveling through the universe.". You nodded in response. You wished you'd be able to go back home, but traveling the stars didn't sound too bad. Kellina then stood up and pulled you to your feet. "Why don't I take you on a quick tour of the ship?" she asked, smiling. "Lead the way." you replied as she led you out of the medical room. You followed her through a series of hallways. You could see that the ship was big enough to hold the population of a small city. You continued to follow Kellina for several minutes until she led you to,
114121121.title: Someone enters the room

1141211211.content: Kellina led you to a small door, which she opened by placing her paw on a small holographic scanner. The door opened to reveal a large room. You were astonished by what you found in the room. There was a large couch next to a small table. There was a small kitchen with a table and chairs. There was a bedroom with a large, comfortable looking bed. There was also a bathroom with a large bathtub. "What is this?" you asked, your voice stuttering slightly. The female cougar giggles and replied "This is my private living quarters. This is usually where I am when I'm not exploring the ship.". "So you live on this massive ship by yourself?" you asked. "Yep." Kellina replied "This ship used to be a luxurious space liner until my father bought it as a gift. I eventually decided to leave and explore the universe. I admit, it does get somewhat lonely around here.". You wrapped your arms around Kellina and she giggled as you caressed her shoulders. She then took a hold of your arm and led you into,
1141211211.title: Her private living quarters

choices: A very loud voice boomed from above, shouting "Blake Ramirez!" Come outside now!
A new spike covered ceiling is being lowered using a huge crane...help, run!
1142.content:
Suddenly I realised I'd been asleep, why and for how long had me baffled.

I came awake, lying on a bed with the blankets all kicked off the end. My semi naked body was a lather of sweat as if I've been having a nightmare, but I cannot remember any bad dream.

There is a vague recollection of something running behind me, something large, shadowy and ferocious. I still felt the uneasiness that follows a feverish sleep, when you don't know what it was you feared, and whether it was in the dream, or whether it's real. Perhaps it's behind me now, but I feel with my right arm, and there's just the wall.

It was the wall of my cabin. I lay there, resisting full awakening, and stare above me. There was a constellation of some strange configuration, with odd sized stars I'd never seen before. On one side of the swirls of heavenly bodies was a large void of blackness, the cold, empty. one-eye socket staring down; a dangerous and all consuming black hole.

With a jolt of returning memory, I jerked wildly and sat up. I peered at the rectangular perimeter of the pattern of stars, my overheated body chilling instantly. The view above me was impossible. I must be still dreaming. It couldn't be a nightmare because there was nothing threatening about the sky above me, dark and night though it was.
No, there was nothing that should frighten me, or bring me feelings of misery, except for one thing.

My cabin no longer had a roof. Or ceiling. I was looking up into the void of space. Then, just when I was ready to jump out of bed, go racing out the door to find an explanation - surely discovering that this was just a nasty dream - the whole ceiling was growing lighter, and instead of outer space, galaxies and stars, there was a huge glowing shape that grew in size until it filled the whole sky above the cabin. The cabin walls were shaking, dust was flying and I knew then without any doubt that this was no dream.

What happened next brought my heart-hammering body upright and the hair on my neck stood up.
1142.title: You notice something in the sky

choices: The Warthog Woman Spoke to me in English
11422.content:
Suddenly, the door burst open. Inside walked some manner of being in a high tech suit of armor resembling that of a storm trooper and it appeared to be breathing heavily. The creature was very strongly built and appeared to have an oddly shaped helmet. The being spotted me and I gasped in fear before I stepped back. The creature was breathing heavily as it came up to me.

"Stay back!" I yelled. "Stay back! Whatever you are!" That's when I slipped and fell. I inched back and found myself in a corner before I gasped. The creature had to be at least ten feet tall and was staring down at me. "P-Please," you say. "Leave me alone." The figure breathed again and pressed a button on their helmet to make it retract until it completely disappeared. I saw the face of the intruder and saw that not only was it a woman (at least I think it was a woman) but she was a bright blue warthog woman with four long tusks, purple hair worn in a mohawk and red markings on her body.

As I stared down, she spoke it a strange alien language I couldn't understand. I had no idea what these aliens had planned for me but it couldn't have been anything good.

Then...
11422.title: The Door Bursts Open

114221.content:
As the warthog woman pinned me down, the door opened again and in walked another anthro alien woman. She was a massive dark gray skinned rhinoceros woman dressed in a spacesuit with purple Tron Lines. She had long red hair reaching down to her butt and appeared to have one diamond eye. She walked up to me as well and it was then I had both a warthog woman and a rhino woman staring down on me. What could these aliens possibly want with me.

The alien rhino spoke in that same alien language and appeared to be having a conversation with the warthog woman. I was becoming very afraid. That's when each of them grabbed me by an arm and pulled me up before walking away carrying me. I had no idea what the aliens had planned for me but I was terrified to find out.

It wasn't long before the rhino and warthog alien girls took me...
114221.title: Another Alien Entered the Room

choices: "Your Planet is About to be Destroyed"
1142212.content:
Both the rhino and warthog women were pulling me into what looked like the main room of the spaceship. I looked out the window and I was horrified. There were dozens of planets in the distance that I couldn't even identify. How far had I been taken to Earth. I was scared of what these aliens would do. Maybe they'd probe me or worse, they might even decide to eat me. This was not looking good for me at all.

The rhino and warthog then put me on the ground in back of what looked like a high tech hovering chair. The rhino spoke in alien language and the chair turned around to reveal an anthro that wasn't like the other two. This one was a muscular male gorilla anthro who was covered in what looked like a Darth Vader outfit combined with a suit of samurai armor.

"Blake Ramirez," said the commander. "Of Earth." I actually gasped as the commander spoke to me. "You speak?! English?!" The commander got out of his chair and walked up to me. He was shorter than the other two aliens but a few inches taller than I was. From the looks of it, he looked like a mutant alien version of the Shredder and that terrified me... a lot. "You must forgive my lieutenants. Their translators were damaged earlier. As for why you're here..."
1142212.title: Take me to Your Leader

choices: As predicted, the planet is now gone, leaving only empty space in its place.
...strangely, the planet isn't destroyed. What's going on?
11422121.content:
"...your planet is moments away from being destroyed." the commander says solemnly, looking out towards the emptiness of space. Your brain freezes, gears twisting as you try to comprehend the information. "C...come again?" "A wandering black hole is on a direct path with your home planet, travelling close to the speed of light. If our math is correct, Earth has about 1 minute and 17 seconds remaining. Give or take a few seconds."

This was certainly news to you. You were surprised that there wasn't an uproar over this on earth, but realized that tracking a black hole moving at nearly the speed of the speed of light is probably not an easy task, and by the time they were able to detect it it'd be too late. But...these guys HAVE detected it. Why aren't they doing anything? "Why aren't you guys doing something about this?" you say accusingly, glaring up towards the commander. "You guys are so much more advanced then us. Can't you, I dunno, deflect it or something?"

The gorilla just chuckles in response. "No, we couldn't possibly hope to stop it. It is a black hole, after all. Does your species even know what a black hole is?" "Yes." you snap back, getting to your feet. "I just mean...couldn't you possibly...there has to be a way to..." you say, before trailing off, a wave of sadness rushing over you. Everything you've ever done. Meaningless. Everyone you've ever met. Doomed. Hell, everyone was doomed. Billions of lives were doomed.

And yet, you weren't...actually, that was an interesting thought. "...why am I here? Why not anybody else? Why am I worth keeping alive instead of, I dunno, the president or someone famous or a scientist or something." you ask, looking towards the imposing form of the commander. "Our scanners have detected that you're the most perfectly average human being, and thus the perfect example of humanity in the wake of it's erasure from the universe." "...Gee, thanks." you say, grumbling to yourself. The gorilla-commander-samurai-darthvader-knockoff puts a furry hand on your shoulder, suddenly snapping you back to attention. "I believe your planet is about to be destroyed. Would you like to watch, or would it pain you too much to see your previous life end?"

"...I'll watch." you say quietly, suddenly being taken back to the seriousness of the situation. Looking up, a large, ultra high-resolution screen is lowered into view, sliding out of the ceiling. On it, the Earth is displayed, hovering in the void of space amongst the stars. "Don't blink, or you'll miss it." the commander says, eyes locked on the screen. You stare at it apprehensively, not sure if you're entirely ready to see your entire life vanish in the blink of an eye. On screen, a timer comes up in the corner, counting down from 10. You begin to count down. "10...9...8..." you say quietly, a hint of fear entering your voice as it falters slightly. "7...6...5..." the commander says with you, joining you. "4...3...2..." comes two more feminine voices, the only two others in the room, the Rhino and the Warthog, as they join in, their translators now functioning.

"1."

You close your eyes.

You open your eyes.
11422121.title: "Your Planet is About to be Destroyed"

114221212.content:
If it weren't for the ridiculousness of the situation, the way everybody joined in to count down the end of your home planet would've been a heartfelt scene. But as it stood, you were too focused on the imminent destruction of your own home planet to care. As the clock ticked down, seconds away from your home planets destruction, you closed your eyes, too scared to watch your planet be devoured by a black hole.

After a few moments, you open your eyes, only to see the counter displaying a big fat "00:00", except the planet is completely intact. You look over towards the gorilla...er, captain in concern, and he murmurs something in an alien language, looking about as confused as a gorilla-creature can look. "What's going on? Why is earth still there?" you ask the captain, no longer feeling as scared, merely confused. "I don't know... the trajectory of the black hole should've decimated the planet right about now...strange..."

In the midst of all this, I finally decided to examine the room I was in. It looked like a fairly stereo-typical main deck, in that it wouldn't look out of place on TV. The room was hexagonal, with half of the 20 foot tall room's walls leaving a giant window in there place. On the rim of the room on the opposite side of the window, there were many computers and screens situated on a few different height levels, and the center of the room is where what you believed was the "Captain's Chair", or equivalent. All in all, it was very nice spaceship. If you weren't still shocked about the whole ordeal you'd consider taking pictures and sharing them with hollywood to use as references.

The commander's eyes remained on the screen throughout your observations. No doubt he was hoping that the time of destruction was merely off slightly, but as seconds turned into minutes he began to get concerned. "So...my planet is fine?" you say, getting his attention, although he doesn't turn to face you. "So can I go home? If you brought me here to keep one of us alive when Earth was destroyed, if it's fine...you don't really need me, do you?"

The commander glances in your direction, looking quite serious, so you shut up, realizing you're unsure of how friendly they are towards you despite all that's happened. "Well, you were right about the first thing. According to our new readings, your planet barely managed to avoid the black hole...but that doesn't mean it's safe from destruction." "Huh? But it missed, shouldn't the planet be fine-" "It nearly missed." the commander interrupted. "And it also sucked up a good chunk of the sun on the way there, I just didn't mention it because hey, the planet'll be gone before they notice, it wouldn't have mattered. But now your whole solar system is destabilized. The sun is now significantly weaker, the black hole may or may not have eaten Mars, and if the Earth survives the following chaos, there's no telling if your species will."

"So what? Are you saying I can't go home?" you ask somewhat forcefully. "You brought me up here, don't I get a say?" "Not really." says the commander, still looking at the screen, which is now displaying the sun...only with random particles of bits of gas strewn about around it, probably from the black hole itself. "But is that what you want? To go back to a doomed planet? No, it would be beneficial for both you and us if you came with us. I'm sorry, that's just how it's going to be."

You're silent. Well, on the bright side, life on earth was quite boring. But these strange, animalistic...things...wanted you to go with them. To where? Their home planet? What did they need a human for, anyway? To 'observe'? That'd be ironic, all things considered. Put in a zoo created by animals. But that was unimportant and you shifted that out of your mind. "Hey, so...what am I? To you guys, I mean?" you say, looking at the commander, then towards the Warthog and Rhino girls, who had been mostly silent. The warthog opens her mouth to begin to speak, but the gorilla shakes his head, and she stops, clearly threatened by the commander's presence. "Well...given the unique circumstances we're now presented with...you're our..."
114221212.title: ...strangely, the planet isn't destroyed. W...

1142212121.content:
"Guest," replied the commander. "Rakka, Tohzar. Take Mr. Ramirez to the guest quarters." You turn your head as two more aliens enter the room, both males. One of them was a gray furred wolf man in a gladiator outfit with a long white beard and the other was a humanoid snapping turtle that looked like a cyborg given the cannons grafted into his shell and his mechanical arm.

The alien wolf and turtle nodded to their captain before leading you down a hallway. The warthog woman then walks up to the captain. "Commander," says the warthog with a slight snort. "He deserves the truth." "Don't patronize me Zeck," says the gorilla man. "He would not be able to handle it if he knew the exact reason why we had to choose him over the six billion humans on the rock." The rhino woman let out a snort. "What I don't understand is why we even bothered to save even one human. I've seen the footage gathered by the probes and from the looks of it, it's a wonder that they hadn't destroy their own species or their own planet before the black hole even had the chance to. The way they treat a superior species, by killing them and disemboweling their nose, making their horns into powder." The rhino snorts and rubs her foot on the ground. "If you ask me, they're better off erased from the universe." The gorilla captain doesn't even respond to that comment.

Meanwhile, you are with the wolf man Rakka and the turtle man Tohzar and you don't like how either one is looking at you. You didn't exactly trust these aliens but from the looks of it they saved your life. Your planet was really dying; so much history art and culture flushed down the toilet of the universe. What could go wrong now.

Rakka and Tohzar lead you down the end of the hall and the door opens to reveal...
1142212121.title: "...guest."

choices: Something crashes in the nearby forest
You notice something in the sky
115.content:
Your name is Tyler Keaton, age 39. You had short brown hair, hazel eyes, often behind a pair of glasses, and a well built body. You had a bit of a nerdy attitude, but was always willing to take on a challenge. You lived in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

Unfortunately, the last few weeks had been very rough on you. You'd recently lost your job at the local hardware store. To make things worse, your girlfriend of 2 months had dumped you for someone else. You had resorted to drinking heavily in order to ease the pain.

You were sitting on the back porch of your house, severely drunk off a bottle of whisky. You were about to head into the house when,
115.title: Tyler

1151.content: You heard a deafening boom, followed by a small quake. You looked out toward the forest to see a column of smoke rising from the trees. "What the hell was that?" you thought to yourself. Still feeling extremely drunk, you decided to,
1151.title: Something crashes in the nearby forest

11511.content: You stumbled down from the porch and toward where the crash had occurred. You walked through a thicket of trees until you came to a large clearing. You found a large metallic object sitting in the clearing. Though your vision was still blurred, you could see it was shaped like a dog's head. It looked like some kind of ship. "What the hell is this?" you said to yourself. Suddenly,
11511.title: Go check it out

choices: Seated at a table with the husky at the other end
In a bedroom as the female kangaroo enters
115111.content:
You slowly approached the ship when a door opens on the side. You quickly hid behind a nearby bush and peered through the leaves. You watched as a shadowy figure stepped out of the ship. The figure was almost humanoid, and appeared to be shaken and battered. You creep a little closer as it steps into one of the still working lights of the ship. It was a tall kangaroo, and judging by the body shape, you assumed it was a female. She had an extremely slim figure. Purple fur covered a majority of her body. Her hands and feet were black, while her belly and chest were grey, and a white patch of fur indicated where her pouch was. She was wearing body armor similar to what a solider would wear.

She looked around, looking somewhat frightened. "H-hello." she said, her voice shaking. Your eyes widened in surprise, she spoke and in perfect English too. You then saw another figure step out. This one was an extremely muscular husky covered in dark brown fur wearing similar body armor. "Rachel, get back inside." the husky said. "Sorry, Jacob." the kangaroo said "I've just always wanted to come to Earth and meet some of the humans that inhabit this planet.". "I understand that your excited, but don't get ahead of yourself." the husky said. The kangaroo nodded. They turned to go back inside the ship, when you accidently stepped on a twig, making it snap, getting their attention. "What was that?" the kangaroo asked. "Must be a human." the husky said, pulling out some kind of gun. You start sweating as he approaches the bush your hiding behind. Then you heard silence, followed by the husky's voice. "Must've been the wind." he said. You sighed with relief as he started walking away. Then you felt something metallic smash against the back of your skull. It must've been one of those aliens, but the blow caused your vision to go blurry. You then heard voices above you. "Must be a civilian." the husky said. "Should we keep him?" you heard the kangaroo ask. "Looks like it, we can't risk him revealing us to his own kind.". the husky replied. You heard the kangaroo scream with delight before passing out. You woke up several hours later......
115111.title: Something emerges from the ship

1151111.content: You woke up to find yourself sitting in a large chair next to a large table. You tried to move, only to find that your arms were braced to the chair. "I see that you've finally awoken." you hear a voice say. You looked up to see it was the husky from earlier, sitting in a chair at the opposite end of the table. You started shaking in fear, frightened of what he might do. You watched as the husky rose from his chair and approached you. "There's no need for you to be afraid." the husky said "I have no intention of harming you.". "Well could you explain why I'm here?" you replied, your voice shaking with fear. "My name is Jacob." the husky replied "I come from a distant planet called Furtonia. My colleagues and I have brought you aboard our ship to take you back to Furtonia with us. It's part of a tradition we have. We come to Earth every 150 years and bring a human back with us to live on Furtonia.". You sat back and let the information sink in while Jacob unlocked your straps. "I understand that you must be confused, but I assure you that everything will be fine." Jacob said as he lifted you out of your seat. He then led you out of the room you were in and through a series of hallways, until you reached,
1151111.title: Seated at a table with the husky at the other end

choices: Rachel puts you inside her pouch
The captain calls you both to the conference room
1151112.content:
You awoke to find yourself laying on a bed in a small bedroom. You sat up just as you heard a noise coming from the door across from you. It opened to reveal the kangaroo from earlier. "It looks like your awake." the she said, smiling. You instantly became nervous and started shaking. "There's no need to be afraid." the kangaroo said as she took your hand and caressed it gently "I assure you that I won't hurt you.". You started to calm down slightly at these words.

"Would you mind telling me what's going on?" you asked, your voice shaking slightly. The kangaroo smiled. "My name is Rachel." she said "I come from a distant planet called Furtonia.". "A pleasure, I guess." you replied "But is there any particular reason why you've brought me here.". Rachel chuckled. "My colleagues and I have brought you on board our ship to take you back to Furtonia with us." Rachel replied "You see, we have a tradition of coming to your planet every 70 years and bringing back a human to Furtonia to live among us.". You looked at here as you let the information sink in. "I understand this is a lot to take in, but I assure you everything will be OK." Rachel said. You sat back as you turned everything over in your mind. Several minutes later,
1151112.title: In a bedroom as the female kangaroo enters

choices: You hear something breack into the house
11512.content:
You assumed it was probably nothing and retreated back into the house. You stumbled around drunkenly until you wandered into your bedroom and collapsed onto your bed and passed out.

You woke up several minutes later, with a massive headache. "I must've had a few too many drinks." you said to yourself. Suddenly,
11512.title: Head back inside

choices: Grab your gun and fight off the intruders
115121.content: Suddenly, you heard the sound of glass breaking. You then hear heavy footsteps. "Crap." you muttered to yourself "Someone's breaking into the house.". You thought of what to do. You decided to,
115121.title: You hear something breack into the house

1152.content:
While sipping from the last drops of whiskey left in the bottle, you look at the night. The sky was clear, cloudless and lots of stars filled your view. One star seemed to be a lot brighter, shining more light than any other star in the sky. You just couldn't seem to look away as it became bigger and whiter. Trying to secure your eyes, you placed your hand over your eyes. This became too bright and eventually you had to look away. "Is the whiskey doing this to me?", you thought, just when a sound started to form from high above you. It sounded just like the wind, but different. It had a more humming sound to it, like an engine.

You suddenly felt a strong force pulling you upwards. First you thought it was just your instinct, which wanted to see what in the world was happening here. But your instinct also noticed something different. Where was the ground? You struggled and waved with your arms, but felt nothing that was solid. Opening your eyes was impossible, as it sure would have blinded you. Helplessly you gave up. You didn't care anymore what was happening and figured it could have been the alcohol doing nasty things with your mind and balance organ. It seemed the situation would not change either, so falling asleep was the only legit option you had in mind. And that was what you needed, rest.

"Ooehaa", you groan while stretching out, slowly waking up. You never knew the wood on your porch could have been this comfy. You playfully kicked your legs in the air to get your body ready to stand up. But in order to do that, you had to open your eyes. Weirdly enough, it didn't seem to make any difference if you had your eyes open or not. "Is it still night?", you wondered, but that would mean even the stars were gone. The smell was also not from anything you could recall smelling earlier in your life. You stretched your arm, and felt metal walls on the left and right sides to you. Panicked by this discovery, you got up, carefully placing your hands before you, so you'd not run into something. No second later your hands hit another wall, and after you turned around and after setting a few steps you felt another one! It meant that you were trapped in a room which was hardly 3 by 8 feet long, slightly bigger than your body. Alarmed you bonked your hands on the metal walls. "Hello! Somebody in here? Hey! Who did this to me? Why am I locked? What is this place! HELLO!!!" Rhythmically and fiercely you hit the metal, not caring that it hurt really bad. You gave up shortly after and laid down on the ground, which softer than you thought, almost like a bed.

Finally, after what had felt like an eternity, you heard faint voices from outside the box. You couldn't understand what exactly they were saying as it was too muffled to tell the words apart. Suddenly, you heard a squeak as a door were opened and soon later light erupted from above you. You looked up and saw to your surprise...
1152.title: You notice something in the sky
